div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards
div.pre: 144 Kiouleler (= Kililer, mod. Kipseli), (563-4) c. 23 km. SE of Larissa, Thessaly, c. 1910 Burial: c. 285-275 B.C. (Newell) Contents: 115 AR Alexander III: 55 lifetime and early post. tetradr. (Amphipolis 23, Pella 1, Sicyon 1, Miletus 4, Sardes 4, Citium 1, Side 2, Myriandrus 1, Aradus 1, Sidon 1, Tyre 1, Ace 1, unc. Phoenicia I, Carrhae 2, Babylon 6, unc. 5) Philip III: 8 tetradr. (Salamis 1, Aradus 2, Marathus 1, Sidon 1, Babylon 2, Susa 1) Demetrius Poliorcetes: 2 tetradr. (Pella) Lysimachus: 5 lifetime tetradr. (1 ea. of Lampsacus, Alexandreia Troas, Per- gamum, Magnesia, Amphipolis) Athens: 43 tetradr. Seleucus I: 2 tetradr. (1 Seleuceia ad Tigrim, as ESM 9) Disposition: Athens Svoronos, Ath√®nes, pl. 31 (Athenian issues) Newell, Demetrius, p. 164, WSM nos. 9 and 13 (Carrhae coins) and p. 42, note 20 (burial date) Newell's record of issues in ANS
